text: Solo a Genova is a live solo album by keyboardist Jamie Saft recorded at the Teatro Carlo Felice in Italy and released on the RareNoise label in early 2018.RareNoise Records album details, accessed February 21, 2018 ==Reception== On All About Jazz, Dan McClenaghan said "Pianist Jamie Saft's Solo A Genova is a revelation ... he proves himself strikingly virtuosic, lushly harmonic, and beautifully fluid ... Solo A Genova showcases his uplifting, steeped-in-the- American-sound soul" while Doug Collete noted "Jamie Saft's first solo album in his twenty-five year career, Solo a Genova, captures this restless, daring artist interpreting a selection of songs that reflect his eclectic taste as a reflection of his customary willingness to challenge himself. The sum effect of hearing this recording from Italy in March of 2017 is an altogether glorious experience made all the more stirring by the inclusion of audience applause".McClenaghan, D., All About Jazz Review 1, January 28, 2018Collette, D., All About Jazz Review 2, January 18, 2018 Broadway World observed "Solo a Genova is Saft's highly emotive take on jazz standards and other uniquely American compositions ... The rare, emotional outpouring and transformative power of Saft's piano is in evidence throughout Solo a Genova, his brilliant solo piano debut".Jamie Saft's First Solo Album 'Solo a Genova' Out on RareNoise, 1/26, BWW Music, January 14, 2018 A Jazz Noise's Dave Foxall wrote "Jamie Saft’s first solo album is an unrestrained experience, taking an eclectic mix of material – jazz, rock, pop, blues, modernist classical, and a few Saft originals – and creating an hour’s coherent listening without sacrificing any of the variety ... Blues spirit, classical lyricism, jazz dexterity – as solo piano albums go, slot it into your collection right next to Mingus Plays Piano, Jarrett’s Köln and Monk’s Alone in San Francisco.Foxall, D.
